Articles.Content:
Ayep. I didn\'t know what else to call the thread, but it\'s a place I will shamelessly advertise my music which is one of the few things by me that I\'m actually proud of.

http://soundcloud.com/triassic

Two uploaded so far, more to come...eventually.

Also some KSP (or just generally spacey) tracks:

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/575558/KSP%20-%20Soundtrack/01%20-%20Walking%20On%20The%20M%C3%BCn.mp3

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/575558/KSP%20-%20Soundtrack/02%20-%20This%20Asteroid%20May%20Or%20May%20Not%20End%20Civilization.mp3

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/575558/KSP%20-%20Soundtrack/03%20-%20Spiders%20In%20Space.mp3

I came into this expecting something mediocre. Thank god I was wrong.

Also, If \'The good earth\' had a download option, you\'d best bet I\'d download it. Excellent soundtrack for Mun missions. Especially when the Kerbin - rise is exactly synched to Borman\'s 'Good night, good luck, a Merry Christmas, and God bless all of you - all of you on the good Earth.'

I came into this expecting something mediocre. Thank god I was wrong.

Only I\'m allowed to have poor expectations of myself!
I want to make more KSP tracks but I can\'t think of anything I haven\'t already covered with the three already posted...

I know this may not exactly be your style, but all of your tracks are pretty high energy, excellent for high-energy action; like launch, or any kind of action-ey stuff.

When I\'m drifting out in space, on the other hand, I far prefer more majestic, orchestral things; like Strauss\'s Blue Danube Waltz, Grieg\'s Funeral March (for when I know they aren\'t going home) or Holst\'s Planets (appropriate for almost every occasion!) Sure, I may just be some guy, but hey, I like flappin\' my gums sometimes.
Reworking some of the KSP tracks and made a few new ones that will be put into a free-to-download album when I get enough. Specifically designed for spaceflight or things that need quiet music!
You\'re just loaded with talent all the way around aren\'t ya.

Mostly finished, still needs a better intro I think: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/575558/alamamamalalmam.mp3

http://soundcloud.com/triassic/astrology
